result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed by DA office Pam B. arc
for victims brother to appear via zoom on 10/31. Filed by ADA Ellenwood. arc     Approved by SRN on 10-31-2022. JA informed Victim Witness. RJG

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least 4 times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges. I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

Defendant to sign Extradition form

Defendant to surrender passport to St. Croix County Clerk of Court upon release. 

 It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, G.F, M.F & M.F. or family.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:07 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: C. Dillon, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Amber Lea Pospisil in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Amber Lea Pospisil.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood and Aaron Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF736 & 22TR3607.  DE does not qualify for PD. PFAC given.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Bond argument.  Victims brother makes statements. Court orders bond and schedules next hearing. Adjourned at 1:15 PM. bph
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
